data.title: Strike Action
data.meta_description:
Labor 2 - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. This document defines key terms related to labor relations and labor disputes under Philippine law. It discusses definitions of employer, employee, labor organization, and labor dispute. Some key points include:
- An employer includes any person acting in the interest of an employer, and a labor organization can be considered an employer in relation to its own employees. 
- For a labor organization to be legitimate, it must be duly registered with the Department of Labor and Employment. A union cannot be composed of both supervisory and rank-and-file employees.
- A labor dispute can exist regardless of whether the parties have an direct employer-employee relationship, as long as it concerns terms of employment.
